definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: She was thunderstruck to hear the news.
sentences.chinese: 得知消息時她大感驚訝。

sentences.english: It is simply that the tactic should always respond to the rival in the way that astonishes him most.
sentences.chinese: 就是說一個戰術應該最大程度地引起對手的驚訝。

sentences.english: Tessai is shock that Aizen could stop his attack but the three are gone.
sentences.chinese: 鐵齋驚訝藍染能擋下自己的攻擊，三人組離開。

sentences.english: Buy the pass on a message of sina to Microsoft general, the expert inside course of study expresses generally open-eyed .
sentences.chinese: 對微軟將收購新浪的傳言，業內專家普遍表示驚訝。

sentences.english: If you have been to Yangshuo, you must have been surprised by its green mountains and clear rivers.
sentences.chinese: 如果你曾經去過陽朔，你一定驚訝於那裏青山碧水。

sentences.english: To his surprise, the new neighbor is his primary school.
sentences.chinese: 令他驚訝的是，這個新鄰居竟然是他的小學同學。

sentences.english: The owner and small dust is all quite surprised, might it not be this white dress is the youth also a coquette?
sentences.chinese: 老闆和小塵都十分驚訝，莫非這白衣少年也是狐狸精？

sentences.english: Naval experts said they were amazed by the collision.
sentences.chinese: 海事專家說他們對這次撞擊很驚訝。

sentences.english: If he should come tomorrow, we would be greatly surprised.
sentences.chinese: 要是他明天來了，我們會大感驚訝。

sentences.english: Surprised, the old man put on his spectacles and stared at him.
sentences.chinese: 那老人驚訝地戴上眼鏡，望着他。

sentences.english: My friend was on her feet now, with one unbelieving hand against her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友不禁站起身，驚訝得用手捂住了嘴巴。

sentences.english: The triumph of Japanese women football team over The U. S. A surprised the world.
sentences.chinese: 日本女足隊戰勝美國隊讓全世界都很驚訝。

sentences.english: Surprisingly (or not) this is tough to hear.
sentences.chinese: 你是否對這種不常聽到的說法感到有點驚訝。

sentences.english: She looked at the boss in wonder.
Are you surprised to see so many remakes this year?
sentences.chinese: 你會爲今年將看到很多重拍影片感到驚訝嗎？

definition: to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
